meanings.sent1: The incongruities in their opinions led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: The team's success was hindered by the incongruities among its members.
meanings.sent3: The incongruities in their dance routine made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The incongruities in their schedules created chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The incongruities in the puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete.

meanings.sent1: The incongruities in his story raised suspicions.
meanings.sent2: The report highlighted several incongruities in the data.
meanings.sent3: The incongruities in her excuses were hard to ignore.
meanings.sent4: The incongruities in his behavior puzzled his friends.
meanings.sent5: The incongruities in the evidence cast doubt on the case.

meanings.definition: Things that do not fit together or make sense
meanings.sent1: The room was filled with incongruities that puzzled the detective.
meanings.sent2: The incongruities in the painting made it intriguing to viewers.
meanings.sent3: The incongruities in the recipe resulted in a strange-tasting dish.
meanings.sent4: The incongruities in the map confused the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The incongruities in the logic of his argument were evident to all.
